information expansion “Chinese encoding character set
1 This document specifies the Chinese graphic characters used in information technology and the hexadecimal representation of the binary codes.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese and other graphic character information.

This document applies to technical class products with the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other text graphic characters, including but not limited to software products such as input method, optical character recognition (OCR), editing, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and Chinese writing, and convenience products such as computers, communication terminal equipment, electronic book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The following documents are referred to in this standard as normative references and are indispensable for the application of this document.
For undated references, the latest edition (including all amendments) applies to this document.
GB/T 2312 1-1980 “Information exchange Chinese character code character set ” Basic set
GB/I 11383-1989 Information processing “Eight-bit coded structure and coding rules for information interchange”
GB/T 13000 Information technology -- Universal character sets, 8 bits
3 Terms and definitions
The following definitions and abbreviations such apply in this document.
3.1 Character
an element of a set of elements used to organize, control, or represent data.
3.2 coded character
the character (3.1) and its encoding is shown.
3.3 Private use area
The user of the product that complies with this document can define the region.
3.4 Vocabulary repertoire
A specified character set (3.1) is represented by a code character (3.2) set.
3.5 保 區 reserved zone
Reserved for future use by this document.
4-word vocabulary
4.1 Introduction
the characters in this file are encoded in single @-@ byte, double @-@ byte , or four @-@ byte segments .
The single byte part includes all 128 characters from 0x00~0x7F of GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 The Dual Phrase Part
The double-byte portion includes all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, all the CJK unified Han characters in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters in the bi-character portion are defined as specified in Appendix A .
The graphic , code position , and function of the symbolic description of the expression should conform to the requirements of Appendix B .
Note: GB/T 13000 unifies the coding of Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, and Vietnam.
Chinese characters with unique abstract shapes are assigned unique code positions; Chinese characters with different abstract shapes but the same source are assigned shared code positions.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-word Segment

The four-character segment includes the 66 CJK Unified Han characters (9FA6 to 9FEF) in GB/T 13000, excluding the 8 characters from 9FB4 to 9FBB), CJK Unified Han characters extension A, CJK Unified Han characters extension BCJK, CJK Unified Han characters extension C, CJK Unified Han characters extension DCJK, and
The characters in the four @-@ segment part are defined as specified in Appendix C .
5 Overall Structure of the System
In the main text, any number preceded by 0x is in hexadecimal, and any number not preceded by 0x is in decimal.
All representations in the appendix are in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
The single byte section adopts the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using the code positions 0x00~0x7F.
The double byte portion of the character is represented by two eight bit binary strings, the first byte from 0x81 to 0xFE and the second byte from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte portion uses GB/T 11383-1989 unused 0x30 to 0x39 as the suffix for the double-byte encoding extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first word character encoding range is 0x81 to 0xFE; the second word character encoding range is 0x30 to 0x39; the third word character encoding range is 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth word character encoding range is 0x30 to 0x39. That is, 0x81308130 to 0x81308139

9.1 General
This document defines three levels of implementation.

The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level should provide the input and output function of all characters within the range of the corresponding implementation level.
9.2 Achieving Level 1

Implement the level 1 composition of the file's single-byte encoding portion, double-byte encoding portion, and four-byte bi-directional formatting portion for CJK Unified Han Character (i.e., 0x82358F33 1 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Han Character Expansion A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 1
Any product covered by this document shall satisfy the requirements of Level 1.
Note: For software applications, any one or more of the non-Chinese character types listed in Table 3 may be used to implement Level 1.
9.3 Achieving Level 2
the level 2 implementation includes the level 1 implementation .
Furthermore, the level 2 implementation also supports the unpaired characters in the General Standard Chinese Characters Table .
The position and shape of the characters in the General Standard Chinese Characters Table in this document are shown in the appendix.
System software and support software shall meet the requirements for level 2 compliance .

Note: System software and utility software includes, but is not limited to, operating systems, database management systems, and middleware (see information on software product classification in GB/T 36475).
9.4 Achieving Level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2 .
In addition, the level 3 realization can also write the entire Chinese characters and the Kanji characters in Table 3 specified in this document.
Products for use in government and public services should meet Tier 3 requirements.

Note: The administrative services and common services industry includes, but is not limited to, railway transportation, road transportation, water transportation, air transportation, intermodal transportation and transportation agency, postal service, logistics, health, state institutions, social security (see GB/T 4754 for information on industry classification).

The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both require one or more of the four steps to process the input file: preprocessing, Hii (compilation), (assembly) MERE (linking) .
The source file extension identifies the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the extension controls the default settings:
gcc treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a C file and sets up the connection in C format,
g++ treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a c++ file and sets up the connection in c++ style.
The source file suffix indicates the language type and the postprocessing:
.c C source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.C C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.cc C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.CXX C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.m Objective-C source program; preprocess, compile, link
.i  preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii  Preprocessed C++ files; compile, assemble
.s  Assembly language source program; assemble
Compiler source program; preprocessing, compilation
.h preprocessor files; usually do not appear on the command line. Other files with suffixes are passed to the linker. Usually include:

.a Archive File
Unless the -cec, -s, or -E option is used (or the compilation error stops the entire process), the connection is always the last step.

During the link stage, all .e files, -1 library files, and unrecognizable filenames (including specified .o H symbolic files and .a library files) corresponding to the source program are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified on the command line.

-fexternal-—templates  Generate smaller code for template declarations (template declarations) (only for c++), by generating a copy of each template function only where it is defined.
To use this option successfully, you must mark #pragma implementation (define) or #pragma interface (declare) in all files that use templates.
When the program is compiled with `-fexternal-templates ', all template instantiations are external types. You must have the required instantiations appear in the implementation file.
This can be achieved with the use of typedef, which references each instance as needed.
Correspondingly, if the default option `-fno-extern-templates` is used at compile time, all template instances are explicitly set to internal.
All member functions (except constructors and the mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual for their class.
This does not mean that every call to a member function will go through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in this case, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch Allows the type of the second and third parameters of the conditional expression to be incompatible.
The value of this expression is Void.-fthis-—is-variable  allows this to be assigned (C++ only).
The merging of user defined free storage management into c++ makes the assignable `this' look out of place.
Therefore, by default, the assignment of this inside a class member function is a no-op.
However, for the sake of backward compatibility, you can make this operation work by using the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Every machine has its own default char type, which may be either unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when the data is symbolic, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
However, many programs are already written in simple char and this is the case with the symbolic numbers (or unsigned numbers, depending on the target machine on which the program is written).
This option, and its opposite, makes such programs work with the corresponding default values.
The type char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it behaves exactly like one of them.
If no `signed' or "unsigned' modifier is explicitly declared, these options define a signed or unsigned bit field.

By default, the bit fields are signed because they inherit the basic integer types, such as int, which are signed integers, but if you specify the `-traditional' option, the bit fields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not do special handling.
This is to support some old programs, and they consider changing the string constant a very bad idea, and the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Exec Summary
COVID-19's impact on the drug market
The impact could be similar to the economic crisis in 2008.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.
in many countries, the disease has overwhelmed and nearly collapsed health care systems, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused severe disruptions in the global economy.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to make drugs, as restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and essential chemicals.
Traffickers are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions and may have to find new routes and methods.
patterns of drug use and supply could change, and the government's ability to respond could be hampered.
The changes brought by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but we can still learn from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began seeking cheaper synthetic substances and turned to injecting drugs.
Meanwhile, governments have been cutting drug-related budgets.
Prevention interventions and drug treatment services could be severely affected if governments respond to the current economic recession in the same way.
Moreover, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced , making it easier for traffickers to operate .
Some countries have a large amount of narcotics smuggled through commercial flights, and the direct impact on drug trafficking activities in these countries is expected to be the largest.

Messengers are carrying methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs in their carry @-@ on bags or in their personal luggage , sometimes in large quantities . With restrictions on air travel in place almost everywhere , the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs is likely to be completely disrupted .
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, activities involving the use of the dark web and parcel post for trafficking may increase.
In the long run, the recession and related lockdowns could disrupt the drug market.

the rising unemployment rate and lack of opportunities will make it more likely that poor and vulnerable people will use drugs in a harmful way, develop drug dependence and turn to illicit drug related activities , whether production or trafficking .
Drug trafficking organizations may exploit these situations to offer services to vulnerable people and recruit new members.
As governments' capacity to respond diminishes, these changes could quickly take root and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and Complexity
market growth
population growth patterns partly explain the expansion of markets .
Drug abuse is increasing worldwide, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the overall population.

the number of drug users was estimated to be 210 million in 2009, accounting for 4.8 % of the global population aged 15 to 64 years , and 269 million in 2018, accounting for 5.3 % of this population .
over the past two decades , the growth rate of drug abuse in developing countries has been much faster than that in developed countries .

this reflects in part the difference in overall population growth during the period , 7 % in developed countries and 28 % in developing countries , but also the faster growth of the young population in developing countries .
teenagers and young adults account for the largest proportion of drug users .
between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group in developing countries grew by 16 percent, while it declined by 10 percent in developed countries.
1 urbanization is a driving factor for the current and future drug markets
in both developed and developing countries , urban areas have higher rates of drug abuse than rural areas .

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the massive rural-to-urban migration of the population. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared with 34 percent in 1960.
urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , particularly in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced .

the increase in wealth is associated with increased drug use , but the burden of disease is greatest among the poorest people worldwide , and drug use is more common in developed than in developing countries .
Cocaine and other drugs are also more strongly associated with the world's wealthier regions.
similarly , within countries , the prevalence of drug use is higher among the socially advantaged .
but the rate of conversion to drug @-@ illness is higher among those with lower socioeconomic status .
data from a few countries indicate that the association between harmful drug use patterns and disease is linked to low income .
These patterns seem less common in wealthier social classes .
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have long been associated with increased drug use, and the pandemic has already forced hundreds of millions of people worldwide out of work.

COVID-19 could lead to further expansion of drug markets COVID-19 pandemic could lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illicit crop cultivation, either because of reduced state control or because of the economic crisis, which may force more people into illicit activities.

The restrictions related to COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, which has likely increased maritime trafficking, which is less risky and more numerous than air or land smuggling.
Recently, there have been reports of cocaine shipments being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
complexity enhancement

the availability of non @-@ internationally controlled substances has stabilized , but the market for illicit drugs is becoming more complex as new and potentially dangerous opioid analgesics are introduced .
Hundreds of synthetic drugs, many of them not under international control, have been added to the mix, along with plant-based substances such as marijuana, cocaine, and heroin.
There are about 500 new psychoactive substances on the domestic market in member countries every year.
at present , the majority are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoids and small amounts of opioids .
although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized , the proportion of substances has changed .
The number of new psychoactive substances classified in 2014 was 200, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.
Many of the new psychoactive substances that are fentanyl analogues have been shown to be effective and dangerous , causing overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere , but to a lesser extent .
In North America, fentanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs , including cocaine and methamphetamine , and is also used to make counterfeit prescription opioids .

evidence of injection of new psychoactive substances of abuse in Europe has emerged : a study of waste syringes in six European cities found that many contained new psychoactive substances of abuse that produce stimulant effects .
the use of new psychoactive substances may be increasingly entrenched among disadvantaged populations .
single types of new psychoactive substances have rarely formed large markets.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among marginalised groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
twenty two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with synthetic cannabinoids identified as the main challenge in most of them .

Controls on precursor chemicals have forced innovation. Many chemicals that were most commonly used as precursors for the synthesis of amphetamine, methamphetamine and "ecstasy" have been placed under international control.

Drug traffickers and manufacturers have been seeking alternatives to controlled substances, not only those with looser controls, but also chemicals designed to evade controls, known as "tailor-made precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put further pressure on drug makers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests this has become a reality: in March 2020, a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia reportedly drove up prices for methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
the market is changing so fast.
Synthetic opioids replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the opiate markets in Central Asia and the Russian Federation seem to have undergone changes between 2008 and 2018 .
the number of opioids seized by the Russian authorities has fallen by about 80 % , and the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use disorders has decreased substantially .
But the market for stimulants appears to be growing.
Evidence suggests that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a -pyrrolidinovalerophenone, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities reported a sharp rise in the number of secret laboratories producing various illicit drugs, which more than doubled in two years, reaching 152 laboratories in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq methamphetamine markets grow
The importance of methamphetamine in Iraq was already revealed in 2012 by surveys of hospital, prison and other institutional staff.
crystal methamphetamine has become a major drug of concern , in addition to " ecstasy " and tramadol .
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with drug users saying that marijuana was harder to obtain than "Captagon" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the authorities in Iraq have discovered several methamphetamine laboratories, and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about large imports of pseudoephedrine preparations , which are used as precursors by these laboratories .
in Afghanistan , methamphetamine manufacture appears to have begun in 2014 .
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have steadily risen.
But the seizure volume in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg - a sharp increase compared with the previous year.
The large seizures of methamphetamine believed to originate in Afghanistan in other countries also indicate that the country's production is rising rapidly.
policy changes and trends in policy changes
the trend towards the legalization of marijuana for nonmedical use has been accompanied by an increase in marijuana use in most jurisdictions that have legalized it for nonmedical use .
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the United States allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
in most jurisdictions , cannabis use has increased since legalization , although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical cannabis use .

Adult use of marijuana has increased in Colorado and Washington, the two states that first legalized the drug, particularly in the past month and on a daily or near daily basis, and has surpassed the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, marijuana use in Uruguay has increased, with the number of users almost doubling in the last month.
This suggests that the increase is largely due to frequent and regular marijuana use.
Short-term data from Canada also shows that while the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, usage was also increasing.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illicit sources.
Is the global drop in seizures of cannabis herb due to legalization?
global seizures of cannabis herb fell to the lowest level in 20 years in 2018, with seizures in North America falling by 84 % over the past decade .

By contrast, seizures in the rest of the world nearly doubled over the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at loosening the marijuana market played a key role in the decline.
regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have had a deterrent effect , but the effect of regulation on new psychoactive substances in the United States remains difficult to assess .
countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances have shown different prevalence of use of new psychoactive substances .
in other countries , the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation .
the use of opioids for pain management and palliative care , primarily in the form of pharmaceutical opioids , is concentrated in high @-@ income countries , with unequal regional distribution .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of all opioids available for medical consumption were pharmaceutical opioids , and more than 90 % of those were in high @-@ income countries .
About 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population.
an estimated 88 % of the world 's population resides in low @-@ and middle @-@ income countries , but less than 10 % of the world 's opioid consumption is in the form of pharmaceutical opioids .
barriers to obtaining prescription opioids are related to many factors , including legislation , culture , the health @-@ care system , and prescribing practices .
poorer people are at greater risk of developing the disease , which affects an estimated 35.6 million people worldwide .

poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of and exacerbate the consequences of drug use . This has been confirmed in studies in high @-@ income countries , where the social @-@ economic trajectory of individuals is not only their status at a given point in time , but also related to the risk of drug @-@ use disorders .

the social and economic disadvantage associated with addiction is compounded by the risk of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , which in turn perpetuates the vicious cycle of disadvantage . These outcomes may also be related to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system .

women , ethnic and migrant minorities , sexual and gender diverse groups , people displaced by conflict or disaster , and people living in rural settings may also be disproportionately affected by the disease or face challenges in accessing treatment .

according to the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ years ( DALY ) indicator , which estimates the number of healthy life years lost because of disability and premature death , harmful drug use has had a wider social impact over the past decade .
from 2007 to 2018 , the global disability @-@ adjusted life years attributable to drug use increased by 17 % .
the associated disability adjusted life @-@ years increase was particularly high , at 40 % , for hepatocellular carcinoma caused by untreated chronic hepatitis C in injection drug users .
the relationship between drugs and violence is complex , and it is difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychostimulants and violence .
Limited data from around the world suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicides.
But alcohol seems to play a bigger role in violent incidents than drugs.

Although drug use may lead to criminality , in some cases , this association can be partly attributed to multiple mediators , such as socioeconomic disadvantage , and other types of adversity , such as those caused by individual risk factors , family environment , and peers .
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, large-scale organized criminal activities, including international drug trafficking, can be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the existence and intensity of violence is more dependent on changes that destabilize the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the size of the illicit market, the death or imprisonment of well known criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
the latest trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids are the most harmful
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the related hazards of opioids are often overlooked because they are less commonly used.

of the estimated 167,000 drug @-@ related deaths in 2017 , 66 % were caused by these substances , and 50 % of the estimated 21 million years of life lost due to disability or premature death that were believed to be drug @-@ related .
Synthetic opioid misuse exacerbates public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the crisis is driven by tramadol; in North America, it is fentanyl. The two regions have almost nothing in common in terms of economic, demographic, or drug use patterns, but they are both struggling with an opioid crisis fueled by the availability and low cost of materials to produce them.
in North America , the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to a surge in opioid overdose deaths over the past 20 years .
Two-thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths registered in the United States in 2018 involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason fentanyl causes overdose deaths is that the potency of fentanyl in the illicit drug market is unpredictable.
the market for nonmedical use of tramadol has grown substantially in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa .
in the region, the use of tramadol for the treatment of the condition is increasing among patients.
In 2017, the global seizures of tramadol increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law regulating tramadol, global seizures fell to 32 tons.

The crisis in both places was fueled by the availability of simple and inexpensive manufacturing, as well as a lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl-like substances or their precursors.
The crisis in both places is exacerbated by the fact that these substances are available on both the pharmaceutical and the illicit markets, making it harder to detect and prevent their abuse.
Use of stimulants continues to rise
the cocaine and methamphetamine markets are the most significant in the stimulant field , with both substances experiencing increasing levels of use in their primary markets .
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as cocaine is prevalent in North America and Western Europe.
an estimated 27 million people used amphetamines in 2009 , with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America .
according to most indicators , methamphetamine use has been expanding in both regions for two decades .

in some markets , cocaine and methamphetamine coexist and sometimes substitute for each other , with the use of one drug rising as the use of the other falls and sometimes both increasing and decreasing to meet the same market demand .
COVID-19 increases risk for injection drug users
an estimated 11.3 million people inject drugs , and about 10 % of global HIV infections are attributed to injecting drug use .
More than 1 million people who inject drugs are living with HIV, and 5.5 million are living with hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug overdoses, half of them from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, which is still largely untreated among people who inject drugs.

as some users switch to or increase their frequency of injection , more harmful use patterns may emerge .

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Official: The Process of Acceptance is Stuck in a Rut - Ecns.cn
EU summit dominated by row over refugee policy, EU official says every step of the process is blocked

[Global Times reporter in Belgium, Niu Ruifeng] According to the report of Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on that day, the President of the European Commission, Von der Leyen, said that the EU leaders agreed to issue stricter policies on illegal immigration, so that it would be easier to expel illegal immigrants.

The move by the EU is reportedly in response to growing concerns over illegal immigration in Europe, with the EU's core problem now being the low number of illegal immigrants who can ultimately be deported.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize significant EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been at odds over issues such as the cost of the fence.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some diplomats from member states said that if the EU could share the installation of cameras, observation towers and other infrastructure along the external border, it would free up national budgets and speed up the construction process.

According to the European Euractiv website, EU officials admitted that every step of the refugee reception process was bottlenecked, and the limited reception capacity and the overburdened immigration authorities of member states could not stop refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in EU countries, and the EU's refugee reception system was in a near-"permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, Schengen countries in the EU received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, nearly half of which were more than the previous year.
Meanwhile, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.
In this context, the summit also agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants back to their home countries based on a court ruling by another member state.
In addition, the report said that the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which will pave the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Niu Rifeng)
U.S. Upgrade of "Chip War" to Re-cause Global Semiconductor Industry - Ecns.cn

Recently, the United States has been upgrading its “chip war” against China - first, the Netherlands and Japan, under pressure from the United States, agreed to launch controls on the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; later, foreign media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden government is also preparing to publish an

In recent years, the United States has never stopped its actions to suppress China's "chip" development. On the one hand, it has accurately suppressed the semiconductor supply chain in China, and on the other hand, it has built a "de-sinicization" alliance of semiconductor industry chains, plotting to "completely overtake" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to establish a “technological alliance” with South Korea, or to establish a “four-way alliance” of chips with South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, or to establish a “semiconductor industry chain” through the “Quad” mechanism of the United States, Japan, India, and Australia, or the “Indo-Pacific Economic Framework”, the United States aims to build a closed supply chain dominated by the United States
However, the United States’s “chip warfare” against China is also “injuring one thousand and damaging eight hundred”.

Recently, the Linyi Group, a well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier in the United States, announced that the company would lay off 1,300 full-time employees and 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the impact of the latest round of export bans on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment.

The Dutch ASML, the world's largest semiconductor lithography equipment manufacturer, recently warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

According to the analysis of the American media, after the US government imposed a brutal crackdown on the semiconductor and other industries in China, many American companies were severely affected, including developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of semiconductor manufacturing equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has already formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry chain.

According to the estimation of professionals, based on the specialized division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the border of more than 70 countries, and the whole process takes 100 days.

Although the United States has a strong semiconductor industry, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technologies, and is heavily dependent on the East Asian region.

Even if the United States tries to guide the advanced chip supply chain to develop in the region dominated by the United States, the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry will be difficult to change.
The United States has been vigorously “re-shaping” the semiconductor industry chain “de-sinicized” by China, and has caused a re-creation of the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the global future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the joint participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively issuing the Innovation and Competition Act, the American Competition Act of 2022, and the Chips and Science Act, using its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological superiority; and it has used its “power and authority” to coerce Intel, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, and Samsung, among
In the short term, the United States has indeed created trouble for the development of China's chip industry and related industries, and has reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the United States’ hysterical suppression and forcing China’s chip industry to continuously breakthrough will cause itself to lose a huge Chinese market, and ultimately will greatly weaken the innovation willingness and innovation ability of US technology companies, and harm the development of the global chip industry.

First batch of personal pension investment products launched, with a minimum holding period of 360 days - chinanews.com
First Personal Retirement Investment Products Launched
Seven products from home institutions can be selected, and the shortest holding period is only 360 days.
Personal pension investment products are finally available.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the first list of personal pension investment products, and the 7 personal pension investment products of Guangdong Rural Commercial Bank, Agricultural Bank of China and China Postal Savings were officially launched.

At this point, the “shelves” of personal pension accounts are finally filled with four types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension investment, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public funds.

The first batch of personal pension investment products are all publicly traded net asset value open-end products, of which 5 are new products and 2 are existing products, and except for one product which is a mixed type product, the other 6 products are all fixed income type products.

The Beijing Youth Daily reporter found that among the five new products, four were from Industrial Bank Wealth Management, all of which were fixed income products with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4

The remaining new product is "Postal Savings Wealth Enrichment Huangjing Shortest Holding 1095 Days 1", which is also a fixed income product, and it began to collect on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is grade 2.

Among the two surviving products, one is Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management’s “Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management: Harmony and Dynamics” 360-day technology innovation RMB wealth management product, which is of mixed type and has a risk level of three.

Another surviving product is "Postal Savings Wealth Enrichment Qianjin 1st 365 Days of Short Holding ", a fixed income type, which began to collect funds on December 30 last year and officially started operating on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds, the funds of the individual pension fund account can be invested in financial products such as bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, publicly-traded funds, and so on.
The first batch of personal pension investment products were sold, marking the official launch of personal pension investors to purchase investment products through personal pension fund accounts.

In November last year, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission formulated the Interim Provisions on the Management of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Securities Companies.

The Measures stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension products through their personal pension fund account, including personal pension savings, personal pension investment products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxes issued a notice, which clarified that the individual pension system would be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei Shijiazhuang and Xiong’an New Area, and Jincheng City, Shanxi.
By the end of 2022, the number of participants in personal pensions was 19.54 million, the number of payers was 61.3 million, and the total amount of payments was 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only offered three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and publicly-traded personal pension funds.
Now that the personal pension investment products have also gathered, how should investors choose?

The expert of the research and development department of the Bank of China Wealth Management Products said that compared with other personal pension products, the pilot stage of the pension wealth management product and the personal pension wealth management product have three characteristics.
First, the security, the risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept are more secure, and the independent custody of non-parent bank is implemented.

Secondly, it is long-term. The trial period of the long-term care financial products is 5 years or more. The holding period of the individual long-term care financial products to be issued next is 1 year as a principle, and holding for more than 3 years is encouraged.

Third, it is affordable. The threshold for purchasing products is low, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The rates of custody fees, management fees, and other fees are more favorable.
Professionals pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the products and their risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of long-term, high interest rates, and high safety, suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on guarantees, suitable for people who cannot afford investment risks and can accept stable returns; personal pension investment products and publicly-traded fund products do not guarantee returns, have certain investment risks, but expect higher returns, suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and higher risk tolerance
Text/Reporter, Xinhua News Agency, Cheng Gai, Director, Liu Haibao
Fitness Industry Should Overcome Trust Crisis - Ecns.cn
Another large gym “lightning strike”?
Recently, the rights protection of members of the famous fitness organization, Zhongjing Fitness, has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally, and then rumors about the bankruptcy and fraud of the institution caused members to panic, leading to the involvement of public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization responded and promised to strive to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the storm was finally calmed down.

Some gyms have temporarily closed some of their branches due to operational problems, and consumers could calmly wait for the problems to be solved, why is the first reaction of many members “this is bad”?
The fitness club member abuse scandal is a symptom of a deeper problem in the industry: a crisis of trust.
Domestic traditional gyms generally adopt the prepaid model, and “making money from users who do not come” is the underlying logic of its development.

Through the pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, opening new stores continuously, it seems to be cyclical, but in fact it is eating the ox and the horse, and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
The news of gyms closing and other negative information has been spreading, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market prospect, gym is certainly a good business with “money-making” potential.
The fitness track, although it has ups and downs, has always been the focus of capital.
Multiple data show that the hotness of cultural consumption and other fields is rising, and the market is recovering.

Specifically in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents’ living standards, the concept of healthy life has become popular, and the development of the fitness industry has great potential.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the quality of development.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, and just come out of the crisis, and blow the horn of opening up new land, and invest the financing funds in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in recent years, many institutions have withdrawn due to the epidemic, and the industry has reshuffled. At this time, the powerful enterprises have selectively increased their acquisition strength and rearranged their layout. It is not uncommon to have new opportunities.

However, for the development of the fitness market to enter into a virtuous cycle and move towards a stable and prosperous future, the industry must change its traditional mode and operating strategy.
Only by solidifying and rebuilding the consumer's trust and sense of security can we truly win the market and win the future.
Compared with the market capture of the new store, the current need of the fitness industry is to calm down and optimize the service, and to stabilize the users with high-quality development.
First, you have to retain your customers with service.
The gym belongs to the service industry, and its essence is to adhere to the “user-oriented”, to focus on the user’s needs, and to put the operational focus on the quality upgrading of services.
Secondly, digital transformation can improve user experience.
For example, the current popular Internet gym model, which realizes user pay-per-use and site selection.
At the same time, the body data and the movement data can be effectively used, and the social needs can be met, realizing the complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private promotion and without a large annual card, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness institutions are reduced, and their trust is also improved.
In addition, we should actively explore multiple business forms.

Now, sports consumption has moved from single services to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are expected to become a new entry point for consumption, and peripheral products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment around fitness needs will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.

Nanjing Real Estate Market Reappears “Difference Payment” - Ecns.cn

Yangtze Evening News (reporter: Ma Zhupo) Yangtze Evening News/Zi Niu News Reporter on the 10th found out from an interview that the “price guarantee agreement” that has not been seen for more than ten years has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in the Jiangbei New Area claimed “price compensation”, which means that the discount of other real estate projects is greater than the
"Price-fixing agreement" conditions are not few
The property, located in the Jiangbei New District, is called Poly Yancheng Yuzhuoyintai. Sun, the buyer, told the reporter that he found a “statement” when he visited the property last weekend.

The developer of the project promised in the photos he sent to the reporter that if the buyer purchased the property between February 1 and February 28, the developer would exchange the property for the buyer and return the difference in price if the discount of other properties in the project was greater than the discount enjoyed by the buyer when purchasing the property (limited to other unsold properties of the same type, the same floor, the same unit, and the same type of

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a "price maintenance agreement", which was to make the buyer feel at ease and not worry about the developer's price reduction promotion, "now I'm afraid that after buying it, it will be reduced in price, and I will go to the sales office to make trouble, but I don't have time, and if I don't make trouble, I will definitely be worried."
Many buyers also believe that the "price maintenance agreement" is not a low-priced deal.

Ms. Zheng, who plans to buy a house in Jiangbei, said that the house she wants to buy is a house that is urgently needed. The house must be the same type, in the same building, and in the same unit. There are very few houses that buyers can compare, so the "threshold" is still high.
Some buyers also believe that because of the information asymmetry, the sales may give extra discounts, and it is not easy for buyers to "fight for their rights".
It remains to be seen whether the buyers will stay.

The reporter found on the Nanjing online real estate website that the project sold 252 units in November last year, with floor areas of 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the average selling price of fully furnished units was 39,843 yuan/square meter.

However, more than two months have passed, and the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 8 units have a total of 128 units, 113 units are unsold, and 44 units are unsold in 7 units, and the total number of transactions in the project is only 33 units, accounting for only 1
Market insiders said that "price maintenance agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Lugu West Garden in the Huangshan Road area of Hexi District launched a “price guarantee plan” to attract buyers. The specific content of the plan was that “the company solemnly promises that if the project’s discount range is expanded within one year, the company will return the difference to the old owners according to the difference.”
After that, in April 2011, nine properties in Nanjing also promised to pay the "difference compensation" for a portion of their properties.
“The property market is recovering, and we need a “stimulant” at this time.
“The ‘price guarantee agreement’ is also one of the marketing methods of real estate companies,” said Mr. Shen, a senior trader in the real estate industry in Nanjing.
He believes that developers need confidence more than home buyers, and the launch of the “price guarantee agreement” is actually to boost their confidence.
As for whether the buyers will stay, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the regulatory policies and the loan threshold, and it is still to be observed.

The export volume of 11 major export commodities declined compared with the same period last year.
The decline in plastic rubber and its products and optical instruments was the deepest, with a year-on-year decrease of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
The export of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year on year, the largest decrease in 11 years.
Among them, the annual decline of integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.
The Department of Statistics Chief, Cai Meina, said that this showed the weak demand effect of the consumer electronics industry and the electronics industry entering the correction period.

Statistics show that in January, the import and export of the Taiwan region fell by double digits, and the excess amount of exports was only US $2.34 billion, which was the lowest level in three years.

The Taiwan authorities' financial affairs department believes that the global terminal demand is reduced, the industrial adjustment of the inventory suppresses the willingness of the manufacturers to purchase raw materials, and the export recession is difficult to see improvement in the short term, and the export decline of Taiwan in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the release of the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) was 40.4% in January this year, after seasonal adjustment, down 3.3 percentage points from December last year, and contracted for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring indicator system, PMI is 50% as the line of glory, and the index is greater than 50%, which represents the expansion of the economy, and vice versa is contraction.
Among the five components of the Taiwan PMI in January, new orders, production and employment were tight, supplier delivery time was shortened, and inventory was tight.

All six industries reported contraction in PMI, and the industries were ranked in order of contraction speed as the electricity and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), the electronic and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and the food and textile industry (45.
In terms of prices, the "Statistics Department" of the Taiwan authorities announced that the annual growth rate of Taiwan's CPI in January was 3.04%, which has exceeded 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, which was the highest in 17 months.

The special commissioner of the "Accounting General Office" of Taiwan, Cai Zhihong, frankly admitted that the price increase of vegetables was indeed beyond expectations, excluding the factors of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February of this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and the inflation pressure still exists and is still at a high point.
Looking ahead to Taiwan's economy this year, experts are pessimistic, according to reports by domestic media including the United Daily News and Yahoo Finance.

Professor Wu Daren of the Economics Department of the "Central University" in Taiwan analyzed that the export decline may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturers, and the risk of debt default will rise.
At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of labor costs by manufacturers, which affects the labor market and the family economy, and in turn affects the consumption capacity.

Research fellow of Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, Qiu Dasheng, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and America has not been resolved, and the demand continues to shrink, and it is estimated that the decline of Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy relies on exports, the low export performance will affect the annual economic growth performance.

Report: Number of Chinese Students Returning Home to Seek Employment in 2022 to Reach New High - chinanews.com
2022 graduates seeking employment in China after studying abroad. Sources: 2022 China Returning Employment Survey Report.

ECNS Beijing February 11 (Meng Ru) The recently released “2022 China Returning Home Employment Survey Report” (hereinafter referred to as “Report”) shows that the scale of 2022 graduates has increased by 8.6% compared with the previous year, the number of returning home students seeking employment has reached a new high, and the demand for overseas talents by Chinese enterprises has also increased

The report shows that since 2020, the number of overseas Chinese returning home to seek employment has increased significantly, and the number of graduates returning home to seek employment has increased.
Compared with 2021, the scale of the 2022 graduates increased by 8.6% in 2022, and the number of returning students seeking employment in China reached a new high.

In terms of the distribution of the students who returned to seek employment by the countries where they studied, the United Kingdom had the highest proportion, accounting for 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which were ranked in the same order as in 2021.

In terms of year-on-year growth, the number of students from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore who are studying abroad has increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7% respectively.
The number of graduates from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia has decreased compared with the previous year.
Trends in the supply and demand of returnees after the first week of the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: “2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report”

The survey shows that 58% of the students who decided to return home believe that “life is more convenient in China”, 40% decided to return home because “they are more familiar with the cultural environment in China”, 32% believe that “there are more job opportunities in China”, and 22% believe that the economic activities in China will accelerate and they will have more job opportunities.
Data shows that the current domestic enterprises' demand for overseas talents is rapidly released, and the demand for returning talents is on the rise.

After the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking employment in the country both showed an upward trend in the first week after the Spring Festival, with the number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese increasing by 11% on February 3 and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking employment increasing by 27%.

In terms of industry, the number of positions in the education/training industry accounted for 27.8% of the preferred positions in 2022, ranking first, followed by professional services/consulting and Internet/e-commerce industries with 14.3% and 11.1%, respectively.
The number of overseas returnees who have been seeking employment in China has changed in recent years. Source: 2022 China Overseas Returnee Employment Survey Report

In terms of salary, the average recruitment salary of Haidong for priority positions has been rising for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month (RMB, below) in 2022, an increase of 961 yuan compared to 13,719 yuan/month in 2021, an increase of 7%.

From a regional perspective, the willingness of the sea-returning group to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities, and third-tier and lower cities has increased in 2022, with the proportion of submissions in 2022 being 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3%, respectively, which is higher than the proportion of submissions in 2021.
Regarding the benefits of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that they basically met their expectations, which is 2.8 percentage points higher than the previous year (49.9%).
Twenty-eight percent of those who returned to the sea said they were above or far above their expectations, which is also higher than the 25.4 percent in 2021.

Henan Province Regulates Integration of Prices for Oral Implant Medical Services - Ecns.cn
CCTV News: Dental implants are the ideal choice for many patients with missing teeth, but the price of up to tens of thousands of yuan per tooth has always made many patients hesitate.
Since this year, with the accelerated landing of the collection of implantation, the price reduction of implantation has also been put on the agenda in various places.
From February 10, the price of a single conventional implant in Henan Province is controlled at 4,300 yuan, and the cost of a single conventional implant is no more than 97% of the control target.
Dental implants are a type of tooth replacement in which the upper part of the tooth is supported and anchored by a lower structure that is implanted into the bone tissue .
The reporter learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that the price of a single conventional graft, from planting to final repair, is about 16,700 yuan.
Patient He Wei: After the new policy, the doctor told me that for my condition, it would cost about 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, and I could save about half.

On the basis of the existing projects, Henan Province has also integrated and determined 15 price items of oral implant-related medical services, such as “implantation fee (single)”, and unified the price and payment categories of public medical institutions under the provincial administration, and canceled or adjusted 20 price items of medical services, such as implantation of dental implants.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Pharmaceutical Price and Tendering Procurement Department of the Zhengzhou Municipal Bureau of Medical Insurance: The main beneficiaries are the four parties: the medical insurance, which has less expenditure; the hospitals, which have less pressure; the patients, who will be appropriately increased; the suppliers, who have a market; and the patients, who are the biggest beneficiaries

Support the basic telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization of the 5G network in key areas and places, and add 10,000 new 5G base stations throughout the year, with an average download speed of 500Mbps and an upload speed of 100Mbps in the city, and a download speed of 1000Mbps and an upload speed of 200Mbps in key
Build high quality wireless local area networks.

Based on the “Shen i Network” construction, the city’s unified authentication and management platform for public wireless local area networks is established, and “one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching” are realized, and the operating entities are supported to include self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities into the authentication and management platform.
Upgrade the access to the AP quantity to no less than 20,000 by the end of 2023.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things in the fields of urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and so on, and expand the fixed sensing and smart network of urban roads, buildings, public facilities, and the sensing collection channels of smart cars.

The plan also mentioned that it should strengthen the integration of satellite and ground communication applications, build low-altitude network infrastructure, and promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.

How can the “new variable” in the Chinese e-commerce industry, delivery, achieve “content is king”?
-Chinanews
China News Service, February 11 - Subject: The emergence of "new variables" in China's e-commerce industry, how to make "content king" for delivery?
China News Service reporter Xia Bin
"We entered the e-commerce market late, but from the beginning we realized that content is important if you want to stand out from the millions of stores.
Fang, a "90s" girl from Guangdong, now operates a store selling healthy food ingredients on TikTok, making a 30-year-old offline store "bloom" online.
Mimicking the style of old Hong Kong movies, with classic Cantonese songs, opening the account of @Fangfang on Douyin, the beautiful video is a breath of fresh air.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce “Find Peers·Quality Content Sharing Special Event”, Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke on the stage and shared her experience and insights on daily creations.

She said on the spot: "The carefully polished video has attracted the attention of many netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my family, and want to cook with me, and the sales have opened up at once. "

Fangfang used the video of making soup to let more people love the "flavor of Laoguang", and the live broadcast sold up to 300,000 pieces of nourishing food, which saved the family's store from bankruptcy.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short video and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early days of live-streaming shopping, the live-streaming rooms often used low-price discounts to attract users, and the price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there are many phenomenal Vs such as Liu Yahong and Dongfang Zhan, as well as many unknown people who are experts and merchants in vertical subdivision. They have continuously created high-quality content that suits their brand style, and have improved their long-term operating efficiency.

Haoyang, the operation manager of the KOLs of the TikTok e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have transformed their content through the TikTok e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total transaction amount has more than doubled.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a thriving, vibrant ecosystem of authors.
"Gao Yaohan said.

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform previously released the “E-commerce Industry Content Ecology Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzed the importance of “new variables” - quality content - in the current e-commerce industry from the data dimension, and used the index to evaluate the content ecology situation of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the content ecology health index of the e-commerce industry in the above report, Douyin e-commerce, Huoshan, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked in the top five.

The report believes that the content ecology in the e-commerce industry is an integrated concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce, only good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user original content) are the quality carrier to integrate with e-commerce, the higher the content platform value, the richer the consumption and promotion scene, the higher the possibility of e-commerce insertion,

On the scene, Professor Chai Guoming, a professor at the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and the President of the Chinese Media Economics and Management Special Committee, analyzed and interpreted the Report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has already transitioned from “consumer accessibility” to “consumer quality”, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (Key Opinion Leader) and other PGC content have begun to become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Qi Guoming made two suggestions.

One is from the perspective of promoting the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology, and creating positive content creation and management standards to achieve the system index and dynamic balance of the e-commerce content ecology.
Another is to realize the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value coordination and joint creation of the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more data and AI support to form a prediction for the stability of future development; in addition, it provides more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, realizes the value of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and creates a healthy content ecosystem.
“(Finish)

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) The Biden administration on Friday (February 10) blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the balloon espionage program.

The U.S. Department of Commerce said that the five Chinese companies and one research institution helped the Chinese military modernize, especially in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.
The list, known as the "entity list," bars companies from buying technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they receive special export licenses from the Commerce Department.

The blacklisted companies are: Beijing Nanyang Aerospace Science and Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group Corporation No. 48 Research Institute, Longjiang Lianzu Technology Co., Ltd., Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
The White House had previously said it was considering a broader range of measures to "expose and address" China's threat to U.S. national security through its surveillance activities.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down a balloon, and the Chinese government made a solemn representation to the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously damaging and undermining the efforts and progress of both sides to stabilize Sino-US relations.

Based on the available debris evidence and information from China's procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Ma Xiaoguang said at a press conference on Friday that China had explained the situation and clarified its position on the incident of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle entering the US airspace by mistake due to force majeure.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely political manipulation and hype.
China is firmly opposed to and strongly dissatisfied with that.

"Today's action demonstrates the joint effort to identify and stop China's use of the spy balloons that violated the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries," said Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce for export enforcement.
A staff member at Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co. Ltd. told Reuters he was not aware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States and the Chinese Consulate General in Houston have not commented on the information.
(Reuters)
