(Deutsche Welle) Days have passed since the earthquake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is fading, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday has brought great relief to the rescue workers.
According to the Associated Press, the family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in the hard-hit town of Nurdağı in Gaziantep province.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the rubble, and then found the father, but he insisted on rescuing his son and another daughter first.
The crowd cheered when they were all saved.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man were rescued from the freezing cold.
“What day is it today?
" - the boy, who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours, asked the rescuers who brought him back to the ground.
A man from Kahramanmaraş carries his cat after it was rescued
Miraculous success stories of rescues have brought a glimmer of hope to the already desperate search, but the number of missing people is also rising.
Official statistics say that more than 20,000 people have died in Turkey on Monday's earthquake, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.

Rescuers are continuing to search for victims of the mudslide, but there is little hope of finding further survivors, despite experts saying that people can survive more than a week after being trapped in the rubble.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue effort shifts to helping the survivors who are in desperate need of help.
UN official: Disaster in the region "hundred years have not seen"

The United Nations Under Secretary General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator Martin Griffiths said at a press conference in Turkey that the earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's post-disaster response as "unusual."
He also told Reuters reporters that he hoped to be able to provide aid to areas controlled by the Syrian government and the opposition, but said that the matter was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in relief aid for people affected by the earthquake in Syria.
The United Nations announced earlier this week that it would allocate $25 million in aid to Turkey and Syria.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Chile , Pacific Rim
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by human beings occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The tremor caused localised tsunamis that severely battered the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 metres (82 ft).
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Alaska's Good Friday earthquake
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history struck Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in the world.
When the earthquake struck, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate ruptured near Prince William Sound, just south of College Fjord.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The tsunami was triggered by the seafloor displacement and was 67 meters high.
Schools and many businesses remain closed in Bangui, owing to rampant insecurity.
The quake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while the other 130 died from the tsunami it triggered.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or higher struck Tangshan, a city in Hebei province, China, and Fengnan County within 16 hours of each other.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers below the surface.
Tangshan's entire transportation, communication, water supply, and electricity systems were disrupted, and the city was reduced to rubble in an instant.
Beijing, the capital city 140 kilometers away, also felt the strong tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, the earthquake caused 242,769 deaths and 164,851 serious injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in Chinese history, after the 1556 Shaanxi earthquake.
But some foreign scientists estimate that this earthquake may cause at least 650,000 deaths.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami (2004)
On December 26, 2004, a magnitude 9.1 to 9.3 earthquake occurred 160 kilometers west of the Aceh province of Sumatra, Indonesia, with a depth of 30 kilometers.
The quake triggered a massive tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst-hit areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Thailand's Hua Hin and Phuket resorts, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu state in India.

The disaster struck during the Christmas holiday season, when the affected areas were crowded with tourists and locals, leading to many beachgoers and locals working on the coast being swept away by the tsunami, making the earthquake a disaster with many missing.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people died and went missing.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Sichuan earthquake, 2008
On May 12, 2008, a massive earthquake struck Wenchuan, in China's Sichuan Province.

According to the data of China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2 and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the destroyed area exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had killed 69,227 people, missing 17,923 people, injured 374,643 people to different degrees, and made 199,300 people homeless, with a total of 46.256 million people affected.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, to strengthen the education of the public and the attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Since then, many Chinese governments and primary and secondary schools have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Middle and primary schools also begin to pay attention to popularizing "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
2010 Haiti earthquake
On January 12, 2010, Haiti, a Caribbean island nation, was hit by an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers southwest of the Haitian capital Port-au-Prince, and the earthquake's epicenter was about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The Haitian government has placed the confirmed death toll at over 200,000.
In some parts of Haiti, up to 90% of homes were destroyed in the earthquake.
Despite the massive aid and support provided by the international community, this overpopulated, corrupt and impoverished country has never recovered from the disaster.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Category: 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
On March 11, 2011, a magnitude 9.0 megathrust earthquake occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the earthquake had a depth of 24 kilometers and triggered a massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake was the first to exceed magnitude 9 in Japan's observational history.
About 22,000 people died and around 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
The incident was classified as the most serious of the seven levels of the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident has led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive material around the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years).
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of Syria and Turkey are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, as many as 5.3 million people have lost their homes to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme has appealed for $77 million to provide food for people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area is as low as minus 10 degrees, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents and blankets, but the aid is still failing to reach many of those in desperate need.
In Syria, where the civil war has been raging for 12 years, the earthquake has made the people's misery worse.
In the four days since the earthquake, WFP has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma treatment and emergency surgery.

NEWS GOV-MO: Police Alert: Police Department Warns of Fake Telecom Company Scam Texts

In recent days, the police have received several cases of telephone fraud, where the fraudsters pretend to be from local telecommunications companies and send messages to their victims with a link to a fake website. The message claims that the victim has accumulated points and must claim their prize as soon as possible. The victim is then lured into entering their personal details into the fake website to claim their prize.

The victim entered the credit card information and verification code as instructed, and immediately received a notification from the financial institution that there were unknown charges on the credit card, and suspected that the credit card information had been stolen from the website.
It was confirmed that the relevant telecommunications company did not send the above short message.

The police urge the public to be vigilant when receiving similar text messages and not to click on the links in the text messages or provide any personal information; if you are asked to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, you should be doubly cautious and prevent your credit card from being stolen and used fraudulently.
Avoid fraudulent offers that:
1. Pay attention to network security information, and improve personal prevention awareness;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website, so as to prevent theft;
3. Beware of fake websites and fishing websites, and always pay attention to whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install and update anti-virus software on your mobile phone, mobile device or computer regularly;

5. If you suspect you have been scammed or have been a victim of other crimes, you should immediately call the Police Fraud Investigation Hotline at 8800 7777 or the Police Reporting Hotline at 993 for assistance.

Google AI chatbot "wrongly answers questions" and parent company's stock price evaporates by billions of dollars
(Combined report by Xinhua News Agency on May 11)

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has suffered a setback with a "wrong answer" in a promotional video, causing Alphabet, Google's parent company, to plunge 8.9% on Thursday, falling below the US$100 mark and wiping out US$110 billion (RM476.5 billion) in market value, closing at US$94.57 on Friday.
The market is concerned that Alphabet is not as good as its competitor Microsoft.

Google earlier released a promotional video on social media for its AI chatbot Bard, in which a person asks Bard: "What are some new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) that I can tell my 9-year-old kid about?"
"Bard mentioned in his response that the telescope had taken the first photo of an exoplanet.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration of the United States, the first photo of extrasolar planets was taken by the "Very Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the news with the headline "Alphabet shares plunge after Bard answers wrong question."

On the other hand, Google said that Bard's response "demonstrates the importance of rigorous testing," and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses "meet high standards for quality, safety, and real-world information."
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times over 2021

(Comprehensive report on the 11th) Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it is expected that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 will reach 12 million to 14 million, bringing tourism revenue of about 18 billion to 21 billion Singapore dollars; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-
Singapore's tourism market will gradually restart and recover in 2022.

According to the latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board, the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the earlier estimate of 4 to 6 million by the Tourism Board, and tourists have already recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars. It is estimated that the tourism revenue for the whole year of 2022 can reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times higher than 1.89 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and has already recovered to about 50%
The Singapore government is taking a multi-pronged approach to speed up the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced a $500 million grant to stimulate the tourism industry's recovery.
The Tourism Board announced recently that it will allocate NZ$110 million from the budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract back tourists.

To make health and wellness one of Singapore's tourism highlights, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an expression of interest exercise on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, executive director of sports and wellness tourism at the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their list of considerations.

The development of a health and wellness destination in Marina South, which includes Gardens by the Bay and the Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, allowing visitors to spend more time in Singapore.
Chen said that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has increased public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
To this end, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness programmes to the local public and international visitors over the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held its first Health and Wellness Festival, offering the public more than 130 different types of health activities and experiences.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences for visitors.

In addition to the new Singapore Children's Museum, Gardens by the Bay's Avatar world, Sentosa's Central Beach Market, and the ArtScience Museum's new "Explore New Frontiers" exhibit, as well as the Night Safari's new open-air theater, the Tourism Board will support the development and updating of projects such as Jurong Bird Park, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

Singapore plans to establish industry standards related to the conference, exhibition and incentive travel industry's sustainable development by 2023, with a focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions, and further optimizing the travel environment.
Singapore's tourism recovery has accelerated the aviation industry's recovery.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport passenger traffic has recovered strongly, with more than 150,000 passengers per day, about 1 million passengers per week, which is about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of airline employees has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the data, from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists, equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and 170,000 flights have taken off and landed, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic period.
The tourism industry has recovered rapidly, which has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

According to Qiao Shudan, assistant director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, a survey by Chinese travel platforms showed that Singapore's safety index ranked among the top three in the world, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, China sent about 3.6 million tourists to Singapore every year.
As China relaxes its border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of the number in 2019.
Koo said that in the future, the Tourism Board will closely monitor the signals of further release of China's outbound travel policies to cope with the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms such as Ctrip and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to receive Chinese tourists in response to new trends in outbound travel from China.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected, as long as there is no significant recession affecting public income, and there is no new outbreak of a deadly pandemic on a large scale.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted closely, while his wife was left out of the picture

(Combined Electronic News: August 11) North Korea held a military parade on the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army on the 8th evening, and not only did Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Ju-ae attend, but she also stood on the podium with her father.

The Korean official media released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Jong-un hugging his daughter, who was sitting on his lap, and they exchanged warm glances and whispers several times. She gently hugged her father's face with both hands and even touched his chest. The interaction between father and daughter was broadcast to the whole country.
But the first lady, Ri Sol Ju, had to stand aside.

According to the reports of the Korean “Chosun News” and others, in the official photos of the couple Kim Jong-un and Ri Sol-ju with their daughter Kim Ju-ae attending the dinner on the 7th, not only did Ju-ae sit in the middle of her parents at the C position, but the next evening at the 75th anniversary of the military parade, she also stood on the podium with Kim Jong-un.
The North Korean official media, Korean Central Television, released the parade footage after the parade, exposing more father-daughter scenes.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium, and the two of them never stopped smiling. They also whispered to each other in their ears. Kim Jong-un even lifted his father's cheeks with both hands, and Kim Jong-un responded with a bright smile.

Other official media images also show Kim Jong-un and Kim Yo-jong sitting on an indoor sofa, with the former constantly touching his father's face with his hand; and the latter walking with her father, with her hand on Kim Jong-un's chest.
The first lady, Ri Sol Ju, was only allowed to walk behind or sit next to them, always a few steps away from her husband and daughter.

South Korean media pointed out that Kim Jong-un has been showing up more frequently in public events in the past three months, since the first test launch of the Hwasong-17 missile on November 18 last year. This is the fifth time he has appeared in a formal setting.

The Korean official media mentioned that Kim Jong-un used the most affectionate son, the most honorable son, etc. to refer to his son, and also broadcasted the segment of Kim Jong-un repeatedly shouting his vow to support the bloodline of the white head while looking down at the parade from the reviewing stand.

These signs have led to speculation that Kim Jong-un has already been designated as the successor to the Kim family regime, and the Washington Post has analyzed this as a signal that Kim Jong-un is pushing his teenage daughter to the position of successor. However, there are also views that it is still too early to make such a judgment, and that in the situation where Kim Jong-un has a son, there are still various possibilities.

Q: How does Reignwood Investment view the January US non-farm employment data, which was much higher than expected, and the future trend?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data for January 2023, with 517,000 new non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market's expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; the hourly wage growth rate was 4.4% year-on

In terms of quantity, there are many one-time and technical factors that disturb the data, such as the return of strikers and teachers, the correction of the survey and statistical scope, the update of the seasonal factor, and the subsequent correction (refer to the new non-farm employment of 50.4 million people in January 2022, down to 36.4 million people), and non-farm employment is not as strong as the

In terms of structure, the impact of layoffs on high-tech enterprises is still there, but it is relatively low; the new employment of high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education and health care has increased significantly, and the data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combining the rebound in services PMI, job openings and labor shortages data, which were all larger than expected, and the strength in consumer credit data, we judge that the U.S. services sector has rebounded quickly after the extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tightness of the U.S. labor market will be difficult to improve without a recession.

Currently, the US labor market still has more than 5 million supply gaps, and the labor participation rate is slow to rise, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 year olds has already approached the pre-epidemic high point.
Moreover, the strong consumer demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market, given the strength of the U.S. residential savings and consumer credit.
The tight supply and demand of the US labor market will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.
We are not optimistic about the continued decline in wage growth, given the current near-term end of rate hikes and the repeated inflation expectations.
Before the release of this data, the US stock and bond market was too optimistic about the Fed's interest rate hike path.

As inflation data continued to improve, the Fed maintained a delicate balance between shortening the pace of rate hikes and keeping market inflation expectations in check, but the market ignored the Fed's hawkish tone, expecting not only an earlier end to rate hikes but also two rate cuts by year-end.

Given the tight labor market and the uncertainty about the impact of the tightening policy, we think the Fed's guidance on the end-of-year rate hike is relatively reasonable, and the extreme expectations of the market and the crowded trading could cause some harm to the market.

Xiaoshuang Founder Zheng Yongjian Died of Sudden Heart Disease, and Led China's First Clothing Company to Transform - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website

Economic Observer reporter Zheng Yixin On February 11, the WeChat public account of Shanshan Holdings Limited (hereinafter referred to as “Shanshan Holdings”) issued an announcement that Shanshan Group founder and Shanshan Holdings Chairman Zheng Yongqiang died on February 10, 2023, at the age of 65, due to the failure of treatment for sudden heart disease

In the 1980s, Zheng Yongqiang was the director of the state-owned cotton spinning mill, and after being transferred, he became the director of the Ningbo Yonghong Garment General Factory, the predecessor of Shanshui Stock.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leaders Annual Meeting and the 22nd China Enterprise Future Stars Annual Meeting, Zheng Yongqiang said in his speech that in the 1990s, Shanshan’s market share in the Chinese suit market was as high as 37%.
In 1996, Shanshui Stock (600884.SH) was listed, becoming the first listed company in China's clothing industry.

“Fund Account” is here: The CSRC authorizes the development of the realization of the pooling and query of all funds owned by investors - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer reporter Chen Xi: The complexity of fund purchase channels makes it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the “little treasury”?
These problems of the Kemalists will soon be solved.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E Account" APP was uploaded to various mobile app stores and launched a public test.

The “fund E account” provides a “one-stop” query service for personal investors to obtain information on public fund accounts and shares, aiming to solve the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting accounts and querying being cumbersome for the vast number of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, by the end of 2022, there will be 156 public fund management companies in the country, managing fund scale of about 2.6 trillion yuan; 167 public fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The account systems of the various registration agencies are independent of each other, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
Industry insiders said that at the end of 2021, China’s fund investors exceeded 72 million, which means that half of the country’s population invested in fund products.

Previously, investors needed to inquire about their purchase through different sales organizations, but through the "fund account", they can inquire about all purchase channels and the status of holding the fund at a glance.
What is the “Fund E Account” APP?

According to the relevant documents, the “Fund E Account” APP is a public fund industry portal mobile application developed and constructed by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the off-market shareholding of public fund products in the whole market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the holdings of the offshore shares of the public fund products of the fund managers through the "fund account", which fully improves the query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through the "fund account" includes: the fund account information opened at the public fund management institutions in the whole market, the trading account information opened at the public fund sales institutions, and the off-site shareholding situation of the products such as the open-ended collective asset management plans that have no limit on the number of investors, including the public fund investment in securities and the investment products established and managed by se

Liu Yicheng, the business responsible person of Shanghai Securities Fund Rating Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can know their holdings of all offshore publicly offered funds through the “Fund E-account” app, which helps them find “forgotten assets”, and more importantly, it helps customers to collect comprehensive information on their fund investment situation, which helps customers to grasp their investment situation more timely,
How to register for api?

The reporter noticed that the “Fund E Account” APP has been uploaded to the application stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo, etc., but the APP is still in the public test phase, and the registration requires filling in the invitation code, and investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold to obtain it.

A customer service staff member from a large publicly-traded fund in Shanghai provided the reporter of Economic Observer with a six-digit invitation code and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial phase, and China Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, which investors can obtain by calling us, and we will provide them.
After the trial ends, users can register without the invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the query by downloading and using the relevant documents of the “Fund E Account” announced by the CSRC official website, and the whole process only took a few minutes, and was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After the step of real name authentication, click the “Assets” fund binding button, all the fund products purchased by the reporter through the fund sales platform will be displayed in the binding option list (can be bound account), and after binding, you can directly see the total assets of the fund you have invested in and can start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the “fund E account” only provides query services to investors, and cannot conduct redemption and purchase.
The date shown for "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days prior to the date of the query (T day) by the user.

For example, on February 10, when you open the "Fund E Account", the total assets, fund shares, and fund net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the three trading days before that date, i.e., February 7.

French unions again mobilize against government pension reform plan
French unions launched a new nationwide mobilization on Saturday against the government's proposed pension reform, calling on people to take to the streets to express their views.
It is the fourth day of social protests against the government's draft pension reform.
How many people answer the call to the rally could influence the next steps for the labor group.
It is the fourth time in a month that eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a national mobilization, and the first time that the protests have been scheduled for a Saturday.
Unions are hoping to attract more people to today's rallies, given that Saturday is a day off for most French people and they do not need to choose between joining the protests or going on strike.

Transit, subway and Amtrak unions did not call for a strike today, meaning the transit system should be running normally, allowing people to get to the rally and people in areas where schools are starting winter break to travel.
The unions are hoping for more than a million people to take part in the march, while the police expect between 600,000 and 800,000 nationwide, with between 90,000 and 120,000 in the Paris region.

Since the start of the protests against the government's pension reform plan, the number of people taking to the streets has dwindled, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to delay the legal retirement age from 62 to 64.
The first strike on January 31 brought together between 1.27 million and 2.5 million people across the country.
The crowds on Tuesday, February 7, had dwindled to between 757,000 and two million people nationwide.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
The opposition, particularly the leftist opposition bloc, has submitted numerous amendments, which has slowed down the deliberation process.
The disputes between the two sides of the political spectrum are also becoming more intense and acrimonious.

A member of the French Radical Left Party recently posted a picture of himself kicking a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labor on social media, which has triggered protests from the ruling party.
The National Assembly Speaker ultimately declared the lawmaker ineligible to participate in parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for the behavior.

Despite the fact that this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in more than 20 years, the government has so far made only minor adjustments to the draft and no major concessions.

The unions have already prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 16, and they also plan to organize demonstrations on March 7, when the reform draft will be sent to the Senate for discussion.
China encourages higher birth rates, donating sperm to universities, high quality

The Human Sperm Bank of Yunnan Province in China issued an advertisement on September 9th, calling for donors with a college degree or above, or students, to donate sperm, and those who donate 8 to 12 times will receive a subsidy of 4,500 yuan.

According to the Taiwan media today, the message was hot on Weibo on the day, and it triggered many provinces and cities such as Zhejiang, Shaanxi, Hubei, Shandong and Beijing to follow the initiative.
Chinese universities are encouraging male students to donate their sperm, according to a report by the Liberty Times.

Universities and colleges across the country have donated sperm. Beijing has the highest donation threshold. In addition to academic qualifications, donors must be over 1.7 meters tall, have a good appearance, and not have obvious hair loss or nearsightedness.

According to the report, the Yunnan Provincial Human Sperm Bank said that donors could get a full set of male reproductive system examination worth 1,000 yuan, "especially sperm and chromosome examination, which most people have never done, and it is of great significance to understand their reproductive status."
The donor criteria include being over 165cm tall, having a college degree or above, and not having genetic diseases such as color blindness, B-thalassemia, and infectious diseases.

According to the report, the Shaanxi Provincial Human Sperm Bank has printed advertisements with the slogan "Donate sperm for money, and you will be honored forever," calling on young people to donate sperm, and encouraging netizens to forward the information, "Let love be spread."
Shaanxi Province's price is higher than Yunnan, and qualified people can receive RMB 300 cash each time, and those who have donated sperm a certain number of times can receive RMB 5,000 subsidy.
The highest price known so far is in Beijing, where the maximum subsidy is 5,150 yuan.
East Germany's last communist leader dies
The successor to the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
Four days after the wall that had divided East Berlin from West Berlin for 28 years was opened on November 13, 1989, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, communist leaders were forced from power as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, after coming to power in the Soviet Union, demanded changes in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results caused him to lose his post as Prime Minister.
Despite the reforms, opponents accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for attempting to rebuild the secret police rather than abolishing it.
In 1993, Morales was found guilty of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but he did not go to jail.
The U.S. Justice Department denied the charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament, and from 1999 to 2004 he served as a member of the European Parliament.
Modero sees himself as a reformer who wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want a return of the old East Germany but said the achievements of the East should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.
During World War II, he was a firefighter and a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi militia that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
At 17, Modrow was captured by Soviet forces and taken as a prisoner of war to the Soviet Union, where he took courses in anti-fascism and became a firm communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found work as a mechanic, but continued to study social sciences and economics and earned a doctorate.

Modrow was a staff member of the Free German Youth movement, which was almost universal among East German youth, and rose through the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the Dresden district party between 1973 and 1989.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Mr. Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, holding the highest state office.

The crowd also chanted "Death to Israel."

Adelkhah denied the charges.

Did the balloon incident make America look better?
Strengthen restrictions on technology exports to China
According to the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten the export of technology to China after the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials said the balloon incident highlighted the national security threat posed by China and would help win more political support for strengthening U.S. technology protections.
The US said the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official of the US Central Intelligence Agency and now serving at the Washington think tank New American Security Center.
"This is without doubt fuel on the fire, and supports the view of the hardliners."

"We will also consider taking broader actions to expose and respond to China's larger scale surveillance activities that pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters on Thursday.
"U.S. officials say they have briefed governments in more than 30 countries about the balloon incidents, underscoring the importance of international coordination in responding to the Chinese threat.

Apart from the Biden administration's actions, the new U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party could also put pressure on the U.S. to take more stringent measures to slow down China's development, said Emily Benson, a senior fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
She said lawmakers will feel increasing pressure to take a harder line, which could force the White House to adopt a more aggressive policy.
The Wall Street Journal said that many people who advocated stricter export controls also promoted the expansion of the scope of controls to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government has also been developing a foreign investment review program to examine whether U.S. investments abroad pose potential national security threats from China.
Analysts say the White House may face calls to move more quickly on the plan.
The earthquake relief work in Turkey is going on day and night.

Since a powerful earthquake hit Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked tirelessly in the rubble of thousands of collapsed buildings to dig out survivors trapped under the debris.
In the cold, they often call for silence, as they strain to hear any sign of life from the crumbling concrete piles.
Two more women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake days after the disaster, Reuters reported today.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has seen 20,665 deaths, while Syria has seen more than 3,500 deaths.

The 7.8-magnitude quake that struck on Monday, which has continued to be followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 quake in neighboring Iran.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake to hit the region in two decades, Turkish authorities said on Saturday, as rescuers pulled the women from the rubble of collapsed buildings.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold, rescuers often call for silence as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" -- "God willing" -- as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opens his eyes to see baby Yagiz Ulas wrapped in a blanket being carried into the field hospital.
Video images show that paramedics also took away his mother, who was dizzy and pale but conscious on a stretcher.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, with 31,000 rescuers deployed to the affected areas.
He said that around 80,000 people were receiving treatment in hospitals, while 1.05 million were homeless after the earthquake and were living in temporary shelters.
As many people lack food under the cold winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the two leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has visited a hospital in Aleppo with his wife Asma, state media reported, saying it was the first time he had visited a disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Program said that it was running out of stocks in northwestern Syria, which is controlled by the rebels, because the war situation made the relief work complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey, where he admitted that the government's response had not been as fast as expected.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 that could be delayed by the disaster.
Reuters said that anger over delayed aid and the start of rescue work could affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's two-decade rule.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called "negative moves for political interests."
The main opposition Republican People's Party (CHP) leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu criticized the government's response.
The criticism said, "The earthquake is big, but the lack of coordination, the lack of planning and the incompetence are more serious than the earthquake.

Vietnam News Agency Hanoi - Vietnam News Agency correspondent reported that during his visit to Brunei Darussalam, on the morning of February 11, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, abbreviated as "Brunei University").
The University of Malaya is the largest centre of higher education and scientific research in Malaysia, and is ranked third among universities in the region.
The University of Brunei Darussalam is one of the symbols of Vietnam's cooperation with Brunei in education and training.
In July 2013, the University of Brunei Darussalam officially established a cooperative relationship with Vietnam's FPT University, mainly in the field of English language training.
In addition to English, French, German, Japanese and Korean, Vietnamese is also included in the curriculum of the University of Brunei Darussalam.
During his visit to the University of Brunei, the Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife had a conversation with students of the Vietnamese language class.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh is happy that more foreigners are learning Vietnamese, and he is making a positive contribution to promoting Vietnamese culture, characteristics, and local customs to the world.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh expressed his belief and hope that the Vietnamese language teaching team of the University of Brunei Darussalam will be increasingly strong; the students of the Vietnamese language class will be more interested in the Vietnamese language, strive to learn, and be able to use fluent Vietnamese early, and become the messenger of the friendly cooperation relations between the two countries.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also took the opportunity to communicate with Vietnamese students studying English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Da Nang City via video to understand their learning situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh believed that the cooperation between Vietnam’s FPT University and Brunei University, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, was a vivid symbol of the Vietnam-Brunei education cooperation.

At the same time, he hoped that the students of the center would make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the friendly cooperative relations between Vietnam and the two countries.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the effectiveness of the cooperation between the two countries in education during his talks with the Minister of Education of Brunei and leaders of the University of Brunei, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei, and the inclusion of Vietnamese language in the curriculum of the University of Brunei.
Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh hopes that the University of Malaya will continue to pay attention to ensuring the quality of Vietnamese teaching and further expand the scale of Vietnamese classes.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also highly appreciated the positive results of cooperation between the two countries on the basis of the memorandum of understanding on education cooperation signed in April 2014; he recommended that Vietnam continue to provide more scholarships and effectively implement various short-term exchange training programs, such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the establishment of the first branch of the University of Malaya in Vietnam in Southeast Asia; believed that the university's development scale in the region and the world would become stronger; and further expanded cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife planted a commemorative tree and left a message in the commemorative book at the campus of the University of Brunei Darussalam.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh wished that the University of Malaya would continue to develop and contribute more and more strength to the education cause of Malaysia, and cooperate more deeply and widely with Vietnamese educational and training institutions.

During the meeting with business leaders, panel discussion or attending economic forums, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh emphasized that Vietnam welcomes and creates favorable conditions for Singaporean and Bruneian businesses to expand their investment scope in Vietnam in digital transformation, green energy, high technology, innovation and creativity.

Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah of Brunei and Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh prepare to enter a bilateral meeting.
Photo by Vietnam News Agency
During his visit to the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh arranged time to visit and listen to the thoughts and wishes of the Vietnamese community living in the local area.

During the meeting between the two leaders, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh recommended that the two countries' authorities pay more attention to ensuring that the local Vietnamese community is treated fairly, has the opportunity to contribute to local society, and foster relations between the two countries.
Both suggestions were agreed to and supported by the leaders of the two countries.

In particular, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also shared with the leaders of the two countries their aspiration for a united, peaceful, stable and prosperous ASEAN community; and agreed to maintain unity and cooperation with ASEAN countries and enhance the central role of ASEAN in the complex and changing regional and international situation.

On the basis of the important achievements, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh made positive contributions to the official visit to Singapore and Brunei by effectively implementing the foreign policy line of the 13th National Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam, which prioritizes strengthening relations with ASEAN neighbors, and the 12th conclusion (12-KL/TW) of the Politburo of the Communist Party of Vietnam on the Vietnamese

What is the mysterious "object" that was shot down over Alaska?
It's a twist, it's a twist, it's a twist.
The U.S. military on Friday afternoon again used its most advanced stealth fighter, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying over Alaska.
The crash site is about 10 miles from the Alaska coast.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an aerial object.
A Chinese spy balloon drifted over the United States for days before it was shot down off the coast of South Carolina on Saturday.

The Pentagon said the second object shot down entered U.S. airspace on Thursday evening, was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also believes that there is no evidence that the object is maneuverable.

John Kirby, the strategic communications coordinator for the National Security Council at the White House, said on Friday that while the specific nature of the object flying at high altitude was unclear, it "posed a reasonable threat to civil aviation."
Kobe said that this object was different from the spy balloon found in the United States, and it did not have a "payload" hanging on it.
"We call it a 'thing' because that's the best description we can give it right now," Kobe said.
Biden listened to the Pentagon's advice before ordering the strike, and he made the decision "with great care," Cobie added.

The official description of the object from the US authorities can be roughly summarized as follows: the size is about that of a small car, it has no joystick, no suspension, and a flight altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But this information still does not answer the basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what its mission is.
Many online analyses and speculations suggest that it could be another Chinese balloon.
It may have been launched by China, like the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, performing some sort of mission.
Some have linked the Alaska "object" to an "unidentified flying object" (UFO).
"I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO," former U.S. Representative Peter Meijer tweeted on Friday, according to a report by Newsweek.
"The irony of mixing alien spacecraft with weather balloons is surprising, but it's not worth triggering an interstellar conflict," Meijer said.
MJ tweeted this shortly after Kobe confirmed the Alaska object was shot down.
Newsweek said that Maj. Gen. Garcia is not the only one who doubts that the object was a UFO.

Republican Congressman Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's practice of withholding intelligence last month, calling on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release its report on "unidentified flying objects."

I don't recommend reading it.
I read it a long time ago, and I just happened to see it in my memory.
This book is not a collection of short stories, but a collection of fragments of life about love.
The tone of the book is extremely flat, like plain water, and the words and phrases are extremely simple, and the plot is as quiet and calm as the streets in the afternoon of a summer day.
Each of the short stories is a snapshot of a small part of ordinary life, with no beginning and no end.
They were collected and published under the title What We Talk About When We Talk About Love.

I think this collection of short stories, and its title, is a kind of performance art, the author wants to express that love is not only the stage of joy and sorrow, the urban legend of the hard and rough, not only the sticky and glue, love is not only the above, and should not be represented by the above, love is also the life of the plain and the water, the life of the dry and tasteless, the life of the indifference to life
As you read this book, you may recall the fighting couples around you, the acquaintances's bland marriages, and the unsatisfactory relationships.

This is why I do not recommend reading, from the aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot of the book are tasteless, unless your life is turbulent or sweet like living in a candy castle, otherwise you will feel strange and boring when reading.

And, in terms of depth of thought, the everyday scenarios do not shine or expand one's mind (unlike Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera), and the brief snippets do not explore any issues, such as what kind of mistakes lead to the failure of love.
What are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I wouldn't recommend reading it, but it's not like it's a big deal if you don't.
The authors' ideas are expressed more through techniques and structures than through story, which also makes the reading experience less engaging.
It is suitable for rough reading, but not for detailed reading.
The book is well-logical, but not enough content.
It explains what and why a lot of sales theories are, but is weak on how to do it, just pointing out the direction but not giving specifics.
Also, the book felt like it was pieced together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign; both famous entrepreneurs or salesmen and people who are not well-known.
I don't know if it's a story compiled for the sake of example, and if some cases experienced by the author are added, it will be more convincing.
The customer is still the customer.
The title is still customer, but the content has become customer.
The e-book also had problems with misspellings, missing punctuation, and incorrect numbering.
In short, this book is a good introduction to the theory, but not really for someone who is already in sales and wants to improve their sales.
A Quick Guide to Fintech

This book is very shallow, it can be said that it is only an introduction, it can help you quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, you still have to follow the map and dig it yourself.

And it was written earlier, and the later Alipay and WeChat Pay subsidy war to cultivate user habits has not been mentioned, and the current proportion of third-party payments is probably not as small as it was in the book.
Now many people take their mobile phones with them when they go out to eat, and merchants have also abandoned UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introduction book, which shows that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the financial development history at home and abroad, so it can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It's easy to write high and lofty, the difficult thing is to write in plain language.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know that!
The first factor that determines job satisfaction is not the level of pay, but whether the person is given enough respect and appreciation in the workplace.
According to Maslow’s Hierarchy, humans are innately selfish and need to fulfill their basic needs.
Indeed, for the Chinese people, most of them are “I love you but I can’t say it”, even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their hearts and won’t say it out loud.
In this book, the author explains the five languages of appreciation: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, physical touch, and receiving gifts.

I think the important thing is not to know what the five languages of appreciation are, but to be able to use them at all times, to be able to use them from the heart, to be able to use them to appreciate and to be grateful to the people around you, whether they are family, friends, or colleagues.
In fact, the more intimate the person, the more praise and gratitude are needed, so that our lives will be more beautiful.
Learning to praise can also retain talents to a certain extent and reduce the resignation rate.
Thanks to the translator for bringing us the wonderful foreign thoughts and the world.

Due to the differences in cultural background between the East and the West, there will be some differences between the two languages, and if you have the opportunity to see the original version, I believe you will gain more.
Thanks again to the authors and translators and editors for their hard work!

I don't understand why Amazon wants to send EMS, which is not reliable in the industry, but it's okay, computers are also valuable items!
After the purchase, the order showed that it would be delivered on the 20th, so the family waited at home for three days!
Why does it take four or five days to send from Xiamen to Fuzhou?

On the morning of the 22nd, the logistics arrived in Fuzhou, and I was ready to receive the goods with a smile, but in the evening, without receiving any phone calls or messages, I checked the logistics, and it turned out that it had been signed for at noon, and it even showed that I had signed for it!
I was shocked!
Who am I? Where am I? Is this really my computer?
I seriously doubted if life was good!
I finally got the computer back after running to the pickup point.
The specific reason is that the courier boy turned the two single numbers upside down, but fortunately the package was not lost.
I strongly recommend Amazon not to use EMS, and I will definitely not buy from Amazon again if Amazon uses EMS for delivery.

the worst shopping experience ever

On the night of September 23, my wife dropped her phone, so I immediately ordered an 8p from Amazon Malaysia, which was in stock but not self-owned and did not increase the price (secretly happy), because it was not self-owned, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the estimated delivery date was September 27.

My wife is not happy because she doesn't have a phone, so she called me at 6:30 in the morning to think about a solution, and then she went to JD.com to see if there was any stock, and there was, so she immediately ordered another one.
I just bought it new and was thinking of canceling the Amazon order.

Because the order was placed at midnight, it was impossible for the courier to come to pick up the package at dawn, so I called customer service at around 7:00 to cancel the order, and the customer service representative replied that the order had already been canceled and that I should wait for the notification message.

Okay, I'll wait patiently, and when I checked my phone at noon, the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted customer service to ask them to cancel the order as soon as possible, and the customer service replied that it was already OK.

I checked my phone at 3 pm and saw that the order was still there, so I had to contact customer service again to confirm that I had already called three times, and I asked them to cancel the order and notify the seller that the package must not be shipped!

The customer service contacted the seller on my request, and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system, and that I should wait until the seller was familiar with the system before cancelling the order.
But I was explicitly told by the seller that they knew and that they would not ship.
I checked the order again on Monday and it showed that it had already been shipped, I was speechless.
Because we could not contact the seller directly, we had to call customer service again.
The after-sale service is simply unspeakable, basically I say one step, and the customer service only operates one step.
The order is still in the rejected state, and we are preparing to send it again!
Doesn't Amazon automatically follow up?
The seller's company has received the money anyway, so it doesn't matter if they follow up or not.
In conclusion, we will never pay for the big items in advance, it's too troublesome.
